tit.e: Ebumi-toge Pass (a pass in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City)
Ebumi-toge Pass (a pass in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City)

sen.j: 江文峠（えぶみとうげ）は京都府京都市左京区にある峠である。
sen.e: Ebumi-toge is a pass that runs in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ebumi-toge pass is a pass located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Ebumi-toge pass is a pass located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

tit.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 標高324mの京都府道40号下鴨静原大原線の旧道上に位置する京都府京都市左京区静市静原町と同区大原井出町を隔てる峠である。
sen.e: The pass runs along the old Shimogamo-shizuhara-oharasen Kyoto Fudo 40 Go (Kyoto Prefecture Road 40) at the height above sea level of 324m, marking a border between Shizuichi-shizuhara-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture and Oharaide-cho of the same ward.

It is a pass located on the old road of Kyoto Prefectural Road 40 Shimogamo-shizuhara-ohara Line separating Shizuichi-shizuhara-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture and Oharaide-cho of the same ward at an altitude of 324 meters.

It is a pass located on the old road of Kyoto Prefectural Road 40 Shimogamo-shizuhara-ohara Line separating Shizuichi-shizuhara-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture and Oharaide-cho of the same ward at an altitude of 324 meters.

sen.j: ただし道路地図などでは新たに作られた江文峠バイパス側を峠として記載されているものもある。
sen.e: On the road map, the side of Ebumi-toge Bypass which is newly built is often described as Ebumi-toge pass.
On the road map, the side of Ebumi-toge Bypass which is newly built is often described as Ebumi-toge Pass.
On the road map, the side of Ebumi-toge Bypass which is newly built is often described as Ebumi-toge Pass.

sen.j: 旧道側の峠には金比羅大権現の石碑が建っており、峠の歴史を後に示すものとなっている。
sen.e: On the pass on the old road is built a sekihi (stone monument) of Konpira Daigongen (the Great Kumbhira Avatar), inscribing the pass's history for the future.
On the old road side of the pass, there is a stone monument of Konpira Daigongen (the Great Kumbhira Avatar), which passes down the history of the pass.
On the old road side of the pass, there is a stone monument of Konpira Daigongen (the Great Kumbhira Avatar), which passes down the history of the pass.

sen.j: 車両での通行が可能な峠である。
sen.e: The pass allows automobiles traffic.
The pass is travelable for vehicles.
The pass is travelable for vehicles.

sen.j: 全線に渡って1.4車線程度の道幅のアスファルト舗装された道路が続く。
sen.e: The whole distance is paved with asphalt with the width for 1.4 lanes.
The whole distance is paved with asphalt with the width about for 1.4 lanes.
The whole distance is paved with asphalt with the width about for 1.4 lanes.

sen.j: 勾配は峠が近づくにつれて急になってくるが、それも短区間のみである。
sen.e: Slopes are steeper closer to the pass, but it is only for a short distance.
Closer to the pass, steeper the slopes become, but that is only for a short distance.
Closer to the pass, steeper the slopes become, but that is only for a short distance.

sen.j: 峠には金比羅山へ続く登山道があり、そこを目指す人が多く利用している。
sen.e: Part of the pass is for a pass up mountain leading to Mt. Konpira, and is used by those who aim to climb up the mountain.
Part of the pass is for a path up mountain leading to Mt. Konpira, and is used by those who head to the mountain.
Part of the pass is for a path up mountain leading to Mt. Konpira, and is used by those who head to the mountain.

sen.j: また新道の江文バイパスは原動機付自転車および軽車両は通行不可なので、こちらの旧道へ迂回する必要があり、その点でも旧道としては交通量の多い峠である。
sen.e: Since the new Ebumi Bypass is banned for motorbikes and light vehicles, and those vehicles take detour to the old road, the pass has a lot of traffic for an old road.
Since the new Ebumi Bypass is banned for motorbikes and light vehicles, and those vehicles take detour to the old road, the pass has a lot of traffic for an old road.
Since the new Ebumi Bypass is banned for motorbikes and light vehicles, and those vehicles take detour to the old road, the pass has a lot of traffic for an old road.
